medical_history.chief_complaint: Rapid cognitive decline and worsening jaundice.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Fatigue and cough productive of yellow sputum and flecks of blood developed over the previous 3 months, along with post-tussive vomiting. Symptoms worsened with jaundice, darkening urine, and cognitive changes including somnolence and slurred speech 36 hours before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of alcoholism, elevated liver function tests, anxiety, depression, gout, erectile dysfunction, bursitis of the right shoulder; underwent hemorrhoidectomy 7 years earlier due to rectal bleeding and iron-deficiency anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had cancer, father died of bone cancer, and a cousin had tuberculosis.
medical_history.social_history: History of heavy alcohol consumption (up to 1 liter of vodka per day), did not smoke or use illicit drugs, lived with wife and children, worked in the food service industry and with heavy machinery.
